Justice Sharma, presiding over the bench, issued a comprehensive ruling that seeks to clarify the scope of copyright protection in the digital age.

Justice Sharma, presiding over the bench, issued a comprehensive ruling that seeks to clarify the scope of copyright protection in the digital age.

unnormalised: The plaintiff, T-Series, argued that Saregama had illegally exploited their copyrighted musical works by making them available on various online streaming platforms without obtaining the necessary licenses. They claimed damages amounting to Rs. 5 crore, citing violations of the Copyright Act, 1957. Saregama, in their defense, contended that their actions fell under the purview of fair use and that they had obtained licenses from relevant collecting societies, such as IPRS.
